description: The origin of the verb is uncertain; it is either:
The noun is derived from the verb.

entries.meaning: A botched or incompetently handled action or situation; a blunder.

verbs.description: bungle (third-person singular simple present bungles, present participle bungling, simple past and past participle bungled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To incompetently perform (a task); to ruin (something) through incompetent action; to botch up, to bumble.
(intransitive) To act or work incompetently; to fumble.
